results.title: Preserving our national heritage
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Reese, Balm Paints and Cine Service
results.brief_description: A comprehensive survey of the work of the National Trust and affiliated bodies. Describes how they are preserving, marking and in some cases making available to the public in various states, Australia’s historic buildings, Aboriginal relics, and rare native flora and fauna. Narrated by John Royle.

results.title: Presenting a career in retailing
results.brief_description: Describe the general conditions and points out the advantages of a career in retail selling. Sales and office staff are shown at work in various stores and the promotion system for salesmen and salesgirls is explained.

results.title: Prescription for two: an oldtime comedy
results.brief_description: An oldtime silent comedy. A continually arguing couple are told separately by medical friends that the other has a heart complaint and must be treated with care. This works for a short time until they both discover the ruse. However, they then both really do believe that they each have a heart complaint and call another doctor for his advice. His solution is to give them a prescription for two for living happily together. No credits.

results.title: Preparing for Sarah. Parts 1 and 2
results.brief_description: Three mothers are followed from the time their pregnancies are confirmed to the day they meet with their husbands and babies in the park. The first part of the film deals with aspects of ante-natal care. The second part shows the actual birth and after care.

results.title: Preparation of teachers: student teachers meet two problems in understanding children
results.creator_credit: Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: A dramatised account of the training of teachers in USA, centred round two students studying at a laboratory school at the Ball States Teacher’s College, Indiana. The emphasis is one the need to understand children, to provide for individual pupil differences and to develop desirable personal traits in teachers.
results.title_for_label: Preparation of teachers: student teachers meet two problems in understanding children

results.title: Preparation for parenthood
results.creator_credit: Thora James, Frank Wells and J. Arthur Rank Organisation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Physiology of Human Reproduction”.
The changes which take place in the body during puberty are shown followed by a brief resume of development of the embryo, lactation, menstruation and how multiple births may occur.

group_siblings.title: How we begin
group_siblings.creator_credit: Thora James, Frank Wells and Gaumont-British Instructional

results.title: Prelude to progress
results.creator_credit: Donald Rawlings, A V Curtice and Wallace Productions
results.brief_description: Early in the reign of Queen Victoria, severe competition from the New World caused British farmers to change from cereal crops to dairying. The early practice of cow-keeping in turn grows to the moder dairy industry. The film shows modern methods of production in this industry, including the manufacture of powdered milk, ice-cream, condensed milk, processed cheese and butter.
